result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse J. Robinson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2:03 pm case called. 15CF63, 15CF117, 15TR864, 15TR865 & 15TR1021. Defendant Jesse J. Robinson in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to 15CF63. No Contest to 15TR864. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in 15CF117, 15TR865, & dismisses outright 15TR1021. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Szilagyi. Statement by Defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 15TR864-$761.50 forfeiture inclusive of costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 6 month DL revocation, No IID, OWI Assessment. 15CF63: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2.5 years. CONDITIONS: 60 days WCJ with Huber, No Good Time Credit. Credit for 8 days Time Served. To begin no later than June 1, 2016. AODA and follow through,  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Terms of Agent.  Restituion in the amount of $3889.00 but court finds it is satisfied if paid by the defendant's parents insurance policy. Defendant to obtain a High School Diploma, HSED or GED. Driver's Safety class prior to driving a vehicle. No contact with S. Smith and H. Smith named in 15CF117. Expungement upon successful completion. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA surcharge & sample.  Bond to be applied. Appeal Rights Given.

by USPS - Not re-mailed to DE as the court date has already taken place

15CF-63 and 15CF-117 - Both Cases Called @ 12:05 PM: Defendant Jesse J. Robinson in court with attorney David Paul Frank Templeton.  SPD Ben Szilagyi also present as to 15CF-117.  SPD states he only represents on the new BJump matter.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15CF-117:    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.  Probable Cause finding as to charges in the Complaint.  Def BOT as to 15CF-117.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered in 15CF-117.  Per Def - potential WIAA issues are being looked into with Def's participation in Football program in Freedom - Written application to be filed with WIAA explaining reason for transfer to Freedom.   Application must be filed immediately - Sec 5 Transfer.  STC Scheduled as per Counsel's request - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Prior: W6294 Alpine Dr, Wautoma, WI 54982

Case called @ 1:05 p.m.  Defendant Jesse J. Robinson in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting a $250 Cash Bond. No objection by Atty Szilagyi. Court orders $250 Cash Bond w/ conditions. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 11:30 am.
